mentions.candidate: Councillor James Alexander has been mentioned in various statements from representatives of different political affiliations, each offering their perspective on his capabilities and actions.

endorsements.endorsement: I hope that he continues to be interested and stimulated by politics in the future. I believe that he remains so, as he will be a great asset to whichever organisation he becomes a part of.

endorsements.endorser: Norman Lamont, Former Chancellor of the Ex-chequer
endorsements.endorsement: I am pleased to hear that you are considering a career in politics. I would encourage you to do that.

endorsements.endorser: Local Lib Dem Councillor, Ceredig Jamieson-Ball
endorsements.endorsement: He has dealt with any issues I personally have raised with him efficiently and I am sure that this will be the case for any issues I have asked him to deal with.

endorsements.endorser: Letter from a York resident to The Press
endorsements.endorsement: Although I do not support the Labour party, nor do I have too much time for councillors in general, having met James it is clear that he is young, ambitious, and most of all, willing to listen to other people's opinions.

endorsements.endorser: Former Chair of a York Outer Parish Council
endorsements.endorsement: I am impressed with his ability to interact sensitively with others outside his own community, whilst maintaining a clear focus.

quotes.text: Since Charles Kennedy was ditched they have continued to move to the right. So much now that we see Nick Clegg praising Thatcher and not ruling out helping a minority Tory government.
quotes.source: A York Outer Greens Party member's blog entry
